I recently stayed at Ibis Hotel in Yogyakarta and would like to share my experience through this review: Positive Points: 1. Strategic Location: The hotel is conveniently located, just a 5-minute walk to the Malioboro Area, making it easily accessible by foot. However, navigating by car can be cumbersome due to the one-way road system. 2. Spacious Rooms: The rooms are impressively spacious, providing ample room for guests. 3. Helpful Staff: The hotel staff proved to be helpful and responsive to requests throughout the stay. 4. Great Rooftop Bar and Pool: The rooftop bar and swimming pool offer a delightful experience, adding a positive touch to the overall ambiance. Negative Points: 1. Room Cleanliness Issues: The initial room cleanliness left much to be desired, with dirt from the AC on the floor, smelly towels, and a moldy bathroom. It gave the impression that the maintenance was lacking. 2. High Price for Standard Facilities: During the peak season on 26-27 Dec, the pricing seemed disproportionately high for the standard facilities offered, raising concerns about value for money. 3. Limited Breakfast Options: The breakfast options were disappointingly limited, which may not align with guests' expectations. Conclusion: Unfortunately, my stay at Ibis Hotel Yogyakarta was marred by cleanliness issues, high pricing for basic facilities, and limited breakfast choices. Considering the nearby alternatives with better facilities at more affordable rates, I would not recommend this hotel for future stays.

The room I got was a corner room, maybe that's why it was kind of bigger. The bed was comfortable, all basic facilities; flat screen tv, safe deposit box, mini refrigerator were provided. Bathroom was decent also. Nothing to complain about the room except that there were no electric power outlets on neither side of the bed. So you can not charge any gadgets within hand reach while you're lying on the bed. Breakfast buffet was pleasant, quite a lot of varieties. My personal favourites were the pastries and jamu beras kencur. I also tried the room service. All items in the menu were reasonably priced, quite affordable for a hotel. Randomly picked the Rawon and orange juice, cost me under Rp. 100.000 There are swimming pool, bar and spa on the rooftop. Quiet a cool place to swim, have a drink and some light bites. Too bad I only had time to swim for a while. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. There's a masjid right a cross the hotel, so Muslim guests can perform mandatory daily prayers there. Definitely ibis styles Yogyakarta will be on my priority hotel chose next time I visit the city.

Despite these minor drawbacks, the real highlight of my stay was the exceptional service provided by the hotel staff. The reservation team went above and beyond to accommodate my last-minute requests. The Guest Service Agents (GSAs) during check-in, particularly Ms. Ayu, exemplified Javanese hospitality with warm greetings and effective communication. The concierge / bellman, including Mr. Panji, Mr. Rizal, and Mr. Kiki, demonstrated a high level of professionalism. From assisting with luggage to catering to my needs during the stay, their dedication to providing excellent service was evident. Special mention goes to Mr. Ragil for his politeness while delivering the welcome amenity and snacksâ€”a true reflection of Javanese hospitality. What truly sets Ibis Styles Yogyakarta apart is the staff's commitment to delivering a 5-star experience despite being a 3-star hotel. The exceptional service provided by the team, from the reservation desk to the front desk, exceeded my expectations. I feel compelled to share this positive experience not only in the google review but also with the corporate and brand representatives. The hospitality of the staff at Ibis Styles Yogyakarta is truly top-notch. Mr. Faris and Ms. Ani from front desk were incredibly helpful when I accidentally locked myself out of my room, promptly responding and assisting me in a professional and efficient manner. The reservation team was also highly responsive and accommodating to my last-minute requests, and I was delighted with the upgraded room that exceeded my expectations. These excellent customer service interactions are a testament to the hotel's commitment to delivering a memorable and positive experience for their guests. I sincerely hope that this review serves as a testament to the great and exceptional teams at Ibis Styles Yogyakarta. It is a shining example of how the hospitality industry should operate, and I look forward to experiencing their outstanding service again in the future.
